item.title: Law and Economics: Rational and Objective or Fundamentally Unjust?
item.description:
We are happy to announce our Philosophy Talk of the term presented by Professor Patricia Marino, Law and economics: rational and objective or fundamentally unjust?
WHEN: Wednesday November 5th at 5pm WHERE: Hagey Hall Room 345 DESCRIPTION: Law and economics is the application of economic theory to legal reasoning: in this increasingly influential approach, laws are understood not in terms of justice and rights, but rather as efficient solutions to the problems of organizing society. In normative law and economics, the aim of the legal system is to maximize social welfare. Normative law and economics thus echoes the ethical theory of utilitarianism, where the right action is the one that produces the best consequences. Like utilitarianism, law and economics reasoning faces challenges to do with ethical values such as justice, fairness, and equality: what if the best consequences sacrifice some people's interests for the good of others, increase inequality, or violate other ethical norms? In this talk, I showcase these problems through examples related to tax policy, environmental injustice, and health care resource allocation; I then explain how proponents of law and economics respond to these challenges. We can then discuss together whether law and economics is a rational, objective alternative to arbitrary decision-making or whether its recommendations can be fundamentally unjust.
Snacks and drinks will be provided. This talk is open to all members of the UW community, no experience or expertise in philosophy required. We hope to see you there for an interesting philosophy talk and discussion on philosophy of economics!

item.title: Tabletop Tavern
item.description:
Tabletop Tavern is here for its 5th running and we are back and better than ever! Sponsored by J&J Cards and Collectables & Ravenwood Tabletop, expect this now six-way collab event in SLC 1123 (The Bomber) Sat, Nov. 8th from 12-11pm between UW Board Games Club, WATSFiC, Deceptions Board Games, PokÃ©mon Club, Yu-Gi-Oh Club, and the Magic the Gathering Club to be a day you donâ€™t want to miss!
Come for a day of scheduled events, live performances, a raffle for prizes (sponsored by J&Jâ€™s and Ravenwood), a drinks bar (non-alcoholic), snacks, for-loan games (given you provide your WATCard or Valid ID), items for sale, and so much more!
For each scheduled event you take part in you will get a raffle ticket for a chance to win amazing sponsored prizes at the end of the night! The winners of WATSFiCâ€™s D&D tournament get an additional ticket towards the raffle. To sign-up for WATSFiCâ€™s tournament and guarantee a seat, please see their discord server posts. Walk-in is also available. Any volunteer DMs will also get a free drink from our drinks bar for your efforts!
Again, a big thanks to @jjcardsandcollectibles and @ravenwoodtabletop.ca for agreeing to sponsor the event and offer our raffle prizes, @acornpeanuts for the front poster design, @daidd_an for the rest of the poster designs, and to all the organizing clubs (@uwboardgames @uwdeception @uwyugioh @uwatsfic @uw_pokemon_club and Magic the Gathering) for working so hard to put this all together. We couldnâ€™t have done it without you!
So with that being said, we hope to see you at Tabletop Tavern this term as we get back into the full swing of things! Check each clubâ€™s Discord server announcements for more details. If you want to keep up with each club, donâ€™t hesitate to check out what they have coming up after and/or leading up to Tabletop Tavern!

item.title: Navigating Whatâ€™s Next With Your Arts Degree
item.description: If the future feels uncertain, youâ€™re not alone! This workshop is designed for upper-year students who want to start shaping what comes after graduation: whether that means finding meaningful work, pursuing further studies, or exploring new directions. In this workshop, you will: â€¢Identify your key skills, interests, and values, and learn how they connect to potential career paths. â€¢Discover ways to pivot and reframe your experiences to open up new opportunities. â€¢Explore practical strategies to test your ideas, such as informational interviews, short term projects, or volunteering. â€¢Leave with a clearer sense of direction and concrete next steps to begin your journey. Please note: this workshop is for upper year undergraduate and graduate students in the Faculty of Arts. Registration on the Career Centre Events calendar on WaterlooWorks.

item.description: ðŸ¥§ Prepare for a Feast of Fierce Volleyball! ðŸ¦ƒ As the leaves turn and the holiday spirit fills the air, itâ€™s time for STANK: Serveâ€™s Thanksgiving Annual N(v)olleyball Kompetition! Event Details: ðŸ Date: Saturday, November 15th-16th (Overnight) â° Time: 8pm to 8am ðŸ“ Location: PAC Main Gym + Small Gym ðŸ‚ Team Sign-Up Form your crew of 6 to 9 players (only UWaterloo students with a valid athletics membership or alumni with a day pass) and choose your division: semi-competitive or competitive. Co-ed rules apply: all teams must have at least 2 female-identifying players on the court at all times. (Note: A female libero is required to serve for a middle.) âš ï¸ NEW Semi-Comp Sign-Up Rules (Read Carefully!) To keep play balanced and fair this season: - Any male-identifying player rated Level 5 or of Level 5 ability must set or lib on a semi-comp team. - If you attended UW prior to the 5-level system (graduated before Fall 2023), the same rule applies if you were rated Level 4. - Spring levels are not included in this consideration. - If thereâ€™s any confusion, please reach out to an exec for clarification. - If your team has a Level 5 male player signed up for semi-comp, contact an exec to verify the validity of your team. - Players who are not evaluated this term may be removed from your team on the day of or asked to set/lib if necessary. ðŸ’° Pricing Regular (still fresh out of the coop): Register by Nov 3rd for $200 Both the form and payment must be completed by Nov 3rd @ 11:59pm. ðŸ“ How to Register Make your payment: https://warrior.uwaterloo.ca/Program/GetProgramDetails?courseId=e7072bd1-0754-4e99-9fbe-04a18228cfe1 Fill out the form: https://forms.office.com/r/twpLDkzmhD @everyone ðŸ Letâ€™s spice up the season, rally together, and make this Thanksgiving one to remember!

item.title: AMATH Prof Talk
item.description:
Come join us for an AMATH Prof Talk on neural networks and dynamical systems!
Abstract: In machine learning, neural networks are often used in a feed-forward manner. Or, when a population of neurons is recurrently connected, the updates happen in synchronized jumps. But the neurons in your brain are operating in continuous time. I will show you some ways to bridge the gap to biology, and treat networks of interconnected neurons as a dynamical system. Then, we'll co-opt those networks to do our bidding, and get them to solve dynamical systems.
Pizza and refreshments will be provided to PMC members.

item.title: From Outages to Ownership
item.description:
From Outages to Ownership: Disaster Recovery, DNS, and Career Journeys in Okta Engineering
Ready to see how a top tech company handles the really big challenges? Join us and our Okta engineers for an evening focused on the critical work that keeps our services running; even when major outages happen. Our Staff Software Engineer will kick off the event with a fascinating technical talk, diving into DNS, redundancy, and disaster recovery based on her real-world experience at Okta. Itâ€™s a timely look at how engineering teams build for reliability at scale.
After the deep-dive, youâ€™ll hear from a panel of Engineers from various teams as they share their own career paths, offer a peek into their day-to-day work, and give you practical advice for launching your career. Stick around for our informal networking mixer to connect one-on-one with the team and ask any final questions!
ðŸ”— Link in bio to register

item.title: Voices Empower Walk
item.description: Join us for the Voices Empower Walk on November 22. Meet at the UWaterloo ION Station at 12:20 PM or at Uptown Square before 1 PM. The event runs from 1â€“4 PM. Everyone is welcome. Every six days in Canada, a woman is killed by her intimate partner. In 2024 alone, 187 femicides were recorded nationwide 62 in Ontario between November 2023 and November 2024. This rise in violence demands action. We cannot stay silent. When we walk together, we honor those lost, stand with survivors, and raise funds to help women, gender-diverse people, and children move beyond violence. Together, we walk for change. ðŸ’œ

Join this iERA Dawah Training to learn how to invite others to Islam â€” not just with knowledge, but with impact, wisdom, and compassion.
ðŸ—“ Dates: Tuesday & Wednesday, 25thâ€“26th November 2025 ðŸ•• Time: 6 PM â€“ 9 PM ðŸ“ Location: Islamic Information Centre Address: 200 University of Waterloo Ave W, SLC ðŸ‘¤ Instructor: Br. Ali Usman (Outreach Specialist)

Throughout this workshop, you will learn: * How to start meaningful dawah conversations confidently * How to connect understanding with real-life impact in your dawah. * Key arguments proving the truth of Islam and the divine origin of the Qurâ€™an. * How to convey the message of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) with sincerity and clarity.

item.description: Meet us at the SLC Student Lounge at the University of Waterloo campus on November 27th, at 7PM! Join us for a @staywokeevent @wlupjc @uwvfp @mesalaurier @nasawaterloo collaboration open-mic where we encourage you to Speak Your Truth on all things Palestine ðŸ‡µðŸ‡¸ We invite you all to find community during this time as we are filled with grief, anger, sadness and utter horror for what we are witnessing in Gaza. Performer and attendee registration link is in our bio. ðŸŽ¤ Drinks will be provided by @rommana.cafe â˜•ï¸ Registration will close November 25th at 11:59PM, and performer applicants will receive confirmations by the 26th. By L. Frank Baum With music and lyrics by Harold Arlen and E.Y. Harburg Background music by Herbert Stothart Dance and vocal arrangements by Peter Howard Orchestration by Larry Wilcox Adapted by John Kane for The Royal Shakespeare Company Based upon the classic motion picture owned by Turner Entertainment Co. and distributed in all media by Warner Bros. THE WIZARD OF OZ is presented by arrangement with Concord Theatricals on behalf of Tams-Witmark LLC. LINK: www.concordtheatricals.com -> http://www.concordtheatricals.com . Based on the classic 1939 film and adapted by the Royal Shakespeare Company, The Wizard of Oz remains one of the most beloved musicals of all timeâ€”featuring all the unforgettable songs, characters, and moments that have enchanted audiences for generations. When young Dorothy Gale is swept from the Kansas prairie by a powerful tornado, she lands in the fantastical land of Ozâ€”a world filled with magic, colour, and unexpected danger. Guided by Glinda the Good Witch and joined by a heart-seeking Tinman, a brainless Scarecrow, and a timid Lion, Dorothy embarks on a journey down the Yellow Brick Road in search of the mighty Wizard who can send her home. But the Wicked Witch of the West is never far behindâ€¦ KWMPâ€™s production reimagines this timeless tale for a new generation â€” drawing from the heart of the original while infusing it with a bold, theatrical new vision. Expect the characters you love, the music you remember, and a few surprises that will ignite your imagination. Join us as we rediscover a world where courage, heart, and friendship light the wayâ€¦ and thereâ€™s truly no place like home. Venue: Humanities Theatre, Hagey Hall, University of Waterloo Tickets: Adult $53.21 | Child (12 and under) $37.05 Earlybird Pricingâ€”Save $7 on adult tickets through October 5. Tickets are soon available. Bharat Abroad Events Corp. Rahul, one of India's top stand-up comedians, is a powerhouse performer, host (Shark Tank India Season 2 & 3, Comicstaan S3 Finale) actor, creator and writer. With a global fanbase, he has captivated over 100000 live attendees across shows in 25+ countries, amassing 100M+ views on his content across social media. In 2024-25, Rahul is hitting the road with his brand-new tour "Allow Me!" spanning India, America, the UK, Europe, Australia, and New Zealand.
